FuncDef: The display virtual-cluster-access vp command displays VP information.
CLIs: display virtual-cluster-access vp [ [ source <source-ip-address> ] | [ destination <destination-ip-address> ] | [ vp-id <vp-id-value> ] | [ lsr-role { ingress | transit | egress } ] ] *

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about the VP with a specified source address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Displays information about the VP with a specified destination address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Displays information about a specified VP.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.

Displays information about the VP with a specified node role.
-

Displays information about the VP with an ingress LSR.
-

Displays information about the VP with a transit LSR.
-

Displays information about the VP with an egress LSR.
-

Examples: Source Node ID : 10.2.2.9             Dest Node ID  : 10.4.2.9
VP Role        : Egress              Next Node ID  : --
Source Node ID : 10.4.2.9             Dest Node ID  : 10.2.2.9
VP Role        : Ingress             Next Node ID  : 10.2.2.9
ExtraInfo: After you configure virtual cluster access, run the display virtual-cluster-access vp command to view VP information. The information includes the VP forwarding entries, status of the BFD for VP session, and VP running time.
